programme.title: A Summer in Tuscany
programme.desc: Laura, a journalist, travels to Italy to investigate illegal fashion labour practices and find out more about a family secret. She is soon courted by the charming lawyer Alessandro, but eventually realizes that he isn’t all that he proclaims to be.(n)

programme.title: Hide N' Run
programme.desc: A little girl’s game of “police and thief” with her father is interrupted by the outbreak of riots. Through her perspective, we follow her as she escapes from the shophouse unaware of the chaos unfolding around her.(n)

programme.title: Murder In The Larzac

programme.title: The Lady Diplomat: A Wicked Game
programme.desc: A violent assault on a German tourist pits Ambassador Karla Lorenz against friends and fellow diplomats as she tries to discover who is behind this and a string of other attacks on young women in the city.(n)

programme.title: Slam
programme.desc: When a Palestinian girl disappears, the Australian media jumps on the news like vultures. She is painted as an Islamic extremist who has joined ISIS. Her family vehemently denies the accusations as they struggle to cope with their grief and confusion.(n)

programme.title: The Summer Of Flying Fish
programme.desc: While on vacation with her father, Manena experiences first love, and witnesses the friction between her father, a rich landowner obsessed with exterminating all carp fish in his lagoon, and the local Mapuche tribe who decides to stand up to him.(n)

programme.title: Adam
programme.desc: Abla runs a modest local bakery from her home in Casablanca where she lives alone with her 8-year-old daughter, Warda. When Samia, a young pregnant woman knocks on their door, Abla is far from imagining that her life will change forever.(n)

programme.title: Discovering Mandy

programme.title: The Summer Of Flying Fish
programme.desc: While on vacation with her father, Manena experiences first love, and witnesses the friction between her father, a rich landowner obsessed with exterminating all carp fish in his lagoon, and the local Mapuche tribe who decides to stand up to him.(n)

programme.title: A Summer In Brittany

programme.title: Adam

programme.title: Wacky Heroes
programme.desc: Two penniless brothers embark on a strange mission to protect and give their younger sister a better future. Armed with nothing but masks, cameras and their wits, they set out to take down the neighbourhood criminals. Soon, fame and power comes knocking.(n)

programme.title: Lilly's Bewitched Christmas
programme.desc: Young Lilly summons Ruprecht, a nasty helper from her fairy tale book, to teach her naughty brother a lesson. However, when Ruprecht starts wreaking havoc, she is forced to time travel back to the Middle Ages to find a way to reverse the spell.(n)

programme.title: The Belt
programme.desc: When her friend goes away on a business trip, May’s encounter with her friend’s husband ignites her secret desire for him. She attempts to seduce him in their next meeting, so that she may test his faithfulness.(n)

programme.title: Lost Transport
programme.desc: Spring 1945. A train deporting hundreds of Jewish prisoners gets stranded near a small German village occupied by the Red Army. A chance encounter between German girl Winnie, Dutch Jew Simone and Russian Vera leads to an unexpected friendship.(n)

programme.title: Kids Run
programme.desc: Andi is a former boxer who now struggles as a day labourer. When he loses his job suddenly, he finds himself threatened with the loss of custody of his beloved three children. An amateur boxing competition with a huge prize money becomes his only hope.(n)

programme.title: Superman & Lois S1 15
programme.desc: In the first season finale, Superman’s worst nightmare comes to life, and Lois confronts Leslie Larr (STACEY FARBER). Meanwhile, Lana, Kyle and Sarah stay to help General Lane.(n)

programme.title: Veronica Mars S1 18
programme.desc: A series of fire drills leads Veronica to the discovery that Neptune High has been receiving bomb threats. She enlists Wallace and Mac's (recurring guest star TINA MAJORINO) help to investigate classmates who could pose a serious threat to the school, including new student Ben (JONATHAN TAYLOR THOMAS - "Home Improvement," "Smallville"). Meanwhile, Keith stuns Veronica with the news of whom he's been secretly dating. Later, Duncan confronts Veronica about her ongoing investigation into hissister's death. JOEY LAUREN ADAMS ("Chasing Amy") guest stars as Ms. Stafford, a new substitute journalism teacher.(n)

programme.desc: Determined to keep Annabelle from wreaking more havoc, demonologists Ed and Lorraine Warren bring the possessed doll to the locked artifacts room in their home, placing her “safely” behind sacred glass and enlisting a priest’s holy blessing. programme.title: World's Dumbest S17 3
programme.desc: Caution -- these people are operating motor vehicles under the influence of DUMB. TruTV is counting down the 20 most hysterical Motorheads on the road, in the sky, and on the water. See an out-of-control mail truck, a wild road-rager, and a man treating a motorbike like it's his girlfriend. Our cast of souped-up comedians, including Kevin McCaffrey, Chris Fairbanks, Rachel Feinstein, and Mike Trainor have pulled up to the curb with plenty to say.(n)

programme.title: Life As We Know It
programme.desc: Grey's Anatomy's Katherine Heigl and Transformers' Josh Duhamel play polar opposites Holly and Eric. After a disastrous first date, the only thing they have in common is their dislike for each other and their love for their goddaughter, Sophie. But when they suddenly become all Sophie has in the world, they are forced to put their differences aside. Juggling career ambitions and competing social calendars, they'll have to find some common ground while living under one roof -- and deal with life as we know it. Directed by Greg Berlanti (Brothers and Sisters, Dawson's Creek), this romantic drama also features Mad Men's Christina Hendricks and more.(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Welcome to Rekall, the company that can turn your dreams into real memories. For a factory worker named Douglas Quaid, even though he has a beautiful wife who he loves, the mind-trip sounds like the perfect vacation from his frustrating life - real memories of life as a super-spy might be just what he needs. But when the procedure goes horribly wrong, Quaid becomes a hunted man. Finding himself on the run from the police - controlled by Chancellor Cohaagen, the leader of the free world - Quaid teams up with a rebel fighter to find the head of the underground resistance and stop Cohaagen. The line between fantasy and reality becomes blurred, and the fate of his world hangs in the balance as Quaid discovers his true identity, his true love, and his true fate.(n)

programme.title: The Winchesters S1 6
programme.desc: Mary gets a call from an old friend needing help. Latika struggles with being a Hunter. John’s eagerness, and commitment to the Hunt worries Mary.(n)

programme.title: Container Wars S3 7
programme.desc: The Israelis hang ten on a sweet beach can, but one surprise item may send them off the lot in search of major dollars. Plus, Jason strikes on a container full of wood and weird gear, but will his investment land him in the gutter? And later, a mystery door may check one team into a big loss.(n)

programme.title: Container Wars S3 8
programme.desc: Hot items from New Orleans spice up the bidding, but will the cans bring in the green? Or will a voodoo curse make its mark? Plus, a refrigerated unit sends chills down bidders' spines when they discover its intended recipient is incarcerated.(n)

programme.title: Container Wars S3 9
programme.desc: A new team shakes up the competition and tests Mo's reign as 'the furniture king', while Matthew goes hard after a three-wheel adventure. Plus, an avalanche of ping pong balls causes chaos in the yard.(n)

programme.title: Container Wars S3 10
programme.desc: Four unique containers go up for auction after missing their holiday deadlines. A can of vintage nostalgia has Matt salivating, "Team Muscle turns into "Team Softy," and Uzi gets the scare of a lifetime. Plus, a mysterious logo could be the key tobig bucks.(n)

programme.title: Container Wars S3 11
programme.desc: When jumbo-sized containers make their way to the yard, buyers use every trick in the book to win, big time. A bin full of outdoor BBQs could send two bidders up in flames, while a 'ready-to-go' rave unit sounds like music to the Israeli's ears. Plus, Mo and Ty feel the need for speed, but will their huge bet pay off?(n)

programme.title: Veronica Mars S1 16
programme.desc: Following an emotional reunion with her mother, Veronica is hired to track down Neptune High's beloved mascot, Polly the Parrot, which was apparently kidnapped by a rival school on the eve of a big basketball game. Meanwhile, with her suspicions about the Kane family rekindled, Veronica attempts to gain access to her father's original interrogation tapes. Later, Veronica's relationship with Deputy Leo (recurring guest star MAX GREENFIELD) intensifies, as does Meg's (recurring guest star ALONA TAL) relationship with Duncan.(n)

programme.title: Veronica Mars S1 17
programme.desc: As she continues investigating Lilly Kane's murder, Veronica pursues a risky lead that could discredit Abel Koontz's (not appearing in this episode) confession when she discovers that the convicted killer has a daughter, Amelia DeLongpre (ERIN CHAMBERS), who is about to receive a huge payoff from Jake Kane (recurring guest star KYLE SECOR). Logan stumbles onto Veronica's detailed computer files of everyone connected to Lilly's death. At school, Veronica is hired by a senior student, Sabrina(MEGAN HENNING), to find the party responsible for tormenting her in an attempt to sabotage Sabrina's chances at becoming valedictorian. Sabrina is not well liked by most of her peers, and the long list of suspects includes her ex-boyfriend and herclosest competitor. Meanwhile, unsavory, rival private investigator Vinnie Vanlowe (KEN MARINO) makes Keith a business offer.(n)

programme.title: Veronica Mars S1 18
programme.desc: A series of fire drills leads Veronica to the discovery that Neptune High has been receiving bomb threats. She enlists Wallace and Mac's (recurring guest star TINA MAJORINO) help to investigate classmates who could pose a serious threat to the school, including new student Ben (JONATHAN TAYLOR THOMAS - "Home Improvement," "Smallville"). Meanwhile, Keith stuns Veronica with the news of whom he's been secretly dating. Later, Duncan confronts Veronica about her ongoing investigation into hissister's death. JOEY LAUREN ADAMS ("Chasing Amy") guest stars as Ms. Stafford, a new substitute journalism teacher.(n)

programme.title: Veronica Mars S1 19
programme.desc: While helping a classmate search for her missing terrier, Veronica stumbles onto a bigger mystery, which affects pets all over Neptune, California. Meanwhile, tensions mount in the Echolls family as Trina (recurring guest star ALYSON HANNIGAN) tries to convince the now retired Aaron (recurring guest star HARRY HAMLIN) to accept a role in her new boyfriend's independent movie. Later, Weevil is arrested for breaking into the Kane residence and stealing something from the deceased Lilly's room.(n)

programme.title: The Curious Case Of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: Brad Pitt and Academy Award winner Cate Blanchett star in F. Scott Fitzgerald's story of the life and loves of a man experiencing his life backwards-- The Curious Case Of Benjamin Button. Director David Fincher brings this remarkable tale to the screen. Benjamin Button, is born as an 80-year-old man in New Orleans just after World War I and proceeds to grow younger as time passes. Button, who like any other man is unable to stop time, experiences life and his love for Daisy oddly out of synch with the rest of humanity in this time traveler's tale of the people and places Benjamin Button encounters, the loves he loses and finds, the joys of life and the sadness of death, and what lasts beyond time.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Tell It to the Marines - Charles Winchester becomes even more full of himself when Col. Potter puts him in charge of the 4077th while he is away on business. Winchester even has the cheek to hire Klinger to be his personal manservant, catering to every outlandish whim of the pompous Major. Meanwhile, Hawkeye’s determination and tenacity are needed when he decides to help a young enlisted man to keep his mother from being deported from the U.S. the week before he is to be sent home to her. Hawkeye’s pleas to the Red Cross and Marines have been less than fruitful, so he takes his story to the press and the story becomes a national headline. The young Private is overjoyed when he finds that his mother is not only being allowed to stay in the states, she has a great new job at the Dutch embassy in San Francisco. Charles reluctantly steps down from his throne of authority when Potter returns and Klinger is especially relieved to see the Colonel.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Taking the Fifth - Hawkeye has been experiencing a bit of a drought with the ladies lately, so he breaks out the big guns and tries to tempt passion with a bottle of vintage French wine. Unfortunately for the amorous Hawkeye, all of the nurses show up at once and drink all of his wine and leave him without so much as a cuddle to remember them by. As Hawkeye ponders his strike-out session with the nurses, Potter has more serious fish to fry when he finds that a very important anesthetic for surgery has been banned by the army.(n)

programme.desc: Operation Friendship - Bonds of friendship are forged when an explosion rips through the 4077th's operating room and Klinger saves Charles’ life. Hawkeye is certain that B.J. has injured his hand during the blast but B.J. steadfastly refuses to admit to any pain. Potter eventually agrees with Hawkeye’s diagnosis of B.J.’s hand and calls in a specialist. Although Hawkeye clashes with Capt. Traeger, he eventually stands down and allows the specialist to operate on his friend.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: No Sweat - The summer heat has the members of the 4077th wrestling with hot, sleepless nights as well as a heap of personal problems. Hot Lips has a case of prickly heat that is causing her to be even more pointed than usual, while B.J. is tossing and turning over a troubling letter from Peg. Meanwhile, Klinger’s decision to practice lessons from his mail correspondence electronics course has wrought havoc on the company’s P.A. system. To make matters worse, Charles decides to prepare a mammoth tax return in the mess tent.(n)

programme.title: Cheers S2
programme.desc: Old Flames - Sam’s newly divorced friend tries to come between him and Diane.(n)

programme.desc: Tough Guys Don't Teach - The hospital sends Doogie to high school to teach safe sex practices as the Board of Education feels it would be beneficial for students to learn about such matters from a peer.(n)

programme.title: Airwolf S2
programme.desc: The Hunted - A mysterious industralist sends a group of brisk, dignified, and apparently super-efficient business people to make Dominic Santini an offer he can't refuse to use Santini Air, its personnel, equipment, and facilities for whatever exhorbitant price he comes to name.(n)

programme.title: Charmed S6
programme.desc: Hyde School Reunion - Phoebe accidentally casts a spell on herself that allows her wild teenage personality to take over, and teen Phoebe is eager to use her magic to her advantage.(n)

programme.title: Bewitched S2
programme.desc: Baby's First Paragraph - Tired of hearing how smart Gladys' baby nephew is, Endora uses witchcraft to make Tabitha talk fluently. The speech makes its way into the national news.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S7
programme.desc: Trials And Tribulations - Jessica is accused of bribery and false testimony by the daughter (Carrie Hamilton) of a convicted murderer who is killed in an attempted jailbreak.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit S3
programme.desc: Surveillance - The brutal attack of a young cellist, Cassie Germaine in her apartment leads Detectives Benson and Stabler to investigate her orchestra conductor Robert Prescott.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit S3
programme.desc: Guilt - ADA Cabot goes above and beyond her duty in her search for evidence to convict the serial abuser, which led to an illegal search done by the detectives and in return jeopardises everyone involved.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit S3
programme.desc: Justice - Detectives Benson and Stabler investigate the rape and murder of the stepdaughter of a judge known for his harsh sentencing of sex-offenders.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Letters - The 4077th receives a parcel of letters from a fourth grade class from Hawkeye’s hometown and they quickly learn that not every question has an answer. The children ask surprisingly tough personal questions and each adult has the opportunity to reflect upon their experiences with the war. Some letters are more of a struggle that others but eventually each person manages to write about what the war has been like for them. The letter exchange is so successful that the 4077th soon receive a second sack of mail from another group of students.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Cementing Relationships - Hot Lips finds herself the object of unwanted affections when she comforts an Italian soldier who has been jilted by his girlfriend. Hot Lips solves her problem by telling the enamored soldier that her heart already belongs to Charles Winchester. Meanwhile Hawkeye and B.J. discover the source of a problem with the sterility of their operating room. The wood floor is allowing germs to grow and make the wounded soldiers even more ill than their injuries. The only solution is against Army regulations but Hawkeye and B.J. shoulder the risk themselves and pour a cement floor for the operating room in secret. Charles is surprised when Hot Lips’ Italian paramour returns to camp and wants to face off with him for Hot Lips affections.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Father's Day - The highly decorated war legend “Howitzer Al” Houlihan comes to the 4077th, and his visit is highly anticipated by one person in particular: his daughter, Margaret “Hot Lips” Houlihan. Margaret has always idolized her heroic and distant father and her emulation of his no-nonsense style becomes even more apparent during his visit. Margaret’s numerous attempts to gain the approval of her father are noticed by Col. Potter and he steps in to try and get her father to acknowledge his daughter’s success. Meanwhile, Hawkeye is dubious of a patient’s grateful promise of a steak dinner but he is pleasantly surprised.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Death Takes a Holiday - The 4077th experiences the true meaning of Christmas giving, hosting a party for Korean orphans in the mess tent while working on a critically wounded soldier in the operating room. Charles Winchester becomes the camp scrooge when he selfishly refuses to contribute even the smallest morsel of his enormous Christmas package from home to the orphaned children’s holiday. B.J. Hunnicut, on the other hand, can’t stop giving in his efforts to save the life of a wounded soldier on Christmas Day.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: A War For All Seasons - The 1951 New Year’s celebration begins another twelve months of the simple joys and devastating hardships of war life with the 4077th. During this year we see Hot Lips take up knitting while Father Mulcahy cultivates a garden. Klinger and Charles Winchester become an unlikely alliance in a scheme to capitalize on the National League pennant race while Hawkeye and B.J. develop a strange enthusiasm for the Sears and Roebuck catalog.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Your Retention, Please - The usually happy-go-lucky Klinger falls into a deep depression after reading a “Dear Maxie” letter from his ex-wife, La Verne. Klinger is so out of sorts he actually considers reenlisting for an additional tour of duty in the army. Fortunately for Klinger, his friends have been noticing his out-of-character behavior and Potter is able to step in and keep Klinger from making a hasty decision that he will soon regret. Meanwhile, Hawkeye and the other doctors are appalled that their most talented Corpsman is encountering so much hazing from the men in the unit as he attempts to become a nurse, and the doctors quickly step in to support their friend.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S6
programme.desc: Always A Thief - Charming jewel thief Dennis Stanton (Keith Michell), now an insurance investigator, becomes involved in two murders while checking into the theft of a valuable silver dollar.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S6
programme.desc: Shear Madness - While Jessica is in Texas to attend her cousin Ann's (Shirley Jones) wedding, the bridegroom is murdered, as was Ann's first fiance 15 years earlier.(n)

programme.title: The Love Boat S2
programme.desc: Like Father, Like Son/ Don't Push Me/ Second Chance - A widower and his son (Robert Mandan and Randolph Mantooth) fall in love with the same woman (Cathy Lee Crosby); Isaac (Ted Lange) worries that a young woman on probation (Debbi Morgan), working in the gift shop, has stolen some jewelry; a henpecked man (Roddy McDowall) feels he's being pressured, by his girlfriend (Tammy Grimes), into marriage, against his will.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit S3
programme.desc: Denial - The sexual assault of a heroin addict leads the detectives to the gruesome discovery of a decomposing baby's finger in the victim's purse.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit S3
programme.desc: Competence - When Rebecca reports that her daughter Katie has been raped and is now pregnant, the detectives face the delicate task of determining if Katie was indeed sexually assaulted.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Tell It to the Marines - Charles Winchester becomes even more full of himself when Col. Potter puts him in charge of the 4077th while he is away on business. Winchester even has the cheek to hire Klinger to be his personal manservant, catering to every outlandish whim of the pompous Major. Meanwhile, Hawkeye’s determination and tenacity are needed when he decides to help a young enlisted man to keep his mother from being deported from the U.S. the week before he is to be sent home to her. Hawkeye’s pleas to the Red Cross and Marines have been less than fruitful, so he takes his story to the press and the story becomes a national headline. The young Private is overjoyed when he finds that his mother is not only being allowed to stay in the states, she has a great new job at the Dutch embassy in San Francisco. Charles reluctantly steps down from his throne of authority when Potter returns and Klinger is especially relieved to see the Colonel.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Taking the Fifth - Hawkeye has been experiencing a bit of a drought with the ladies lately, so he breaks out the big guns and tries to tempt passion with a bottle of vintage French wine. Unfortunately for the amorous Hawkeye, all of the nurses show up at once and drink all of his wine and leave him without so much as a cuddle to remember them by. As Hawkeye ponders his strike-out session with the nurses, Potter has more serious fish to fry when he finds that a very important anesthetic for surgery has been banned by the army.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Operation Friendship - Bonds of friendship are forged when an explosion rips through the 4077th's operating room and Klinger saves Charles’ life. Hawkeye is certain that B.J. has injured his hand during the blast but B.J. steadfastly refuses to admit to any pain. Potter eventually agrees with Hawkeye’s diagnosis of B.J.’s hand and calls in a specialist. Although Hawkeye clashes with Capt. Traeger, he eventually stands down and allows the specialist to operate on his friend.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: No Sweat - The summer heat has the members of the 4077th wrestling with hot, sleepless nights as well as a heap of personal problems. Hot Lips has a case of prickly heat that is causing her to be even more pointed than usual, while B.J. is tossing and turning over a troubling letter from Peg. Meanwhile, Klinger’s decision to practice lessons from his mail correspondence electronics course has wrought havoc on the company’s P.A. system. To make matters worse, Charles decides to prepare a mammoth tax return in the mess tent.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S6
programme.desc: The Szechuan Dragon - Jessica's nephew and his wife (Michael Horton, Debbie Zipp) enjoy housesitting in Cabot Cove until they discover the body of a peg-legged murder victim on the living room floor.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S6

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote S7

programme.desc: Depressing News - Klinger decides to give 'The Stars and Stripes' some competition and start a newspaper of his own. He sweet-talks everyone he sees into subscribing and even enlists Hot Lips into writing a beauty column. Even more surprising is Charles Winchester agreeing to write a column on gourmet cooking. In other news, Hawkeye gets a creative bug: when 500,000 tongue depressors are delivered to the unit instead of the requested 5,000 Hawkeye decides to build a monument to the unit out of the surplus.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: No Laughing Matter - Hawkeye bets B.J. he can go an entire day without cracking a joke in order to disprove the suggestion from a Reader’s Digest article, which says that incessant joking stems from chronic insecurity. Charles, on the other hand, is more concerned with the news of a visitor from his past coming to the 4077th. Colonel Baldwin is the man who sent Charles to the Korean front when the Colonel’s cribbage debt to Winchester became outrageously high. The unit watches Charles prepare to meet his tormentor.(n)

programme.desc: Oh, How We Danced - While the rest of the 4077th plans a surprise for a homesick B.J. for his wedding anniversary, Charles is sent to the front lines to make an inspection of the medical facilities. The unit conspires to make a tape of B.J. reminiscing about his life back in San Francisco and what he would have done for his anniversary if he were home. They send the tape home to B.J.’s wife, Peg, who makes a film and tape out of it and sends it back to the unit. Meanwhile, Charles learns Karate from an elderly Korean gentleman in order to feel more secure when visiting the front. Later Hawkeye and Klinger give B.J. a surprise party and show him the film while B.J. dances with Margaret, who stands in for his beloved Peg.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Bottoms Up - A practical joke on Charles backfires on Hawkeye. Charles becomes the unit hero while Hawkeye is booed at in the mess tent and glared at by the general populace. Hawkeye tries a scheme in which he will appear the victim, which also misfires. He then tries to rectify the situation with another joke which also fails miserably, as does the next and the next. Hot Lips has no time for joking when she discovers one of her nurses has a drinking problem.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: The Red/White Blues - Colonel Potter discovers he has high blood pressure two weeks before the annual physical and soon everyone in the camp is watching him to make sure he lays off of the coffee, booze and his beloved cigars. Potter’s blood pressure reaches the boiling point when he finds out Klinger is sixty days behind in his reports to headquarters. Klinger looses the chance for a weekend pass as a result and sinks further into the doghouse when he orders the wrong type of malaria pills. Klinger’s pouting merely aggravates his commander further and the unit crosses their fingers that Potter will pass his physical.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H S9
programme.desc: Bless You, Hawkeye - When Hawkeye begins sneezing for no apparent reason he is tested for every possible allergy. When the attacks become constant he is given bed rest. When it is determined that there is no allergy the consensus is that the sneezing stems from a psychological source and Dr. Sidney Freedman is called in to consult. After two days of gentle probing questions it is discovered that his reaction to a particular smell stems from some triggered childhood memories and Dr. Freedman finds his cure.(n)

programme.desc: Following three inter-Korean summits and two North Korea-U.S. summits, a journey towards peace on the Korean Peninsula has become irreversible. 2019 will see countless twists and turns in negotiations, as all parties involved work to build a lasting peace in search for a winning solution for all. No longer a simply political, abstract notion, peace is now an imperative that leads to the prosperity of the Korean Peninsula and the international community. Arirang TV launches the new program "Peace and Prosperity" to explore paths to peace and prosperity, with a special emphasis on the expected role of Seoul.(n)

programme.title: Peace & Prosperity
programme.desc: Following three inter-Korean summits and two North Korea-U.S. summits, a journey towards peace on the Korean Peninsula has become irreversible. 2019 will see countless twists and turns in negotiations, as all parties involved work to build a lasting peace in search for a winning solution for all. No longer a simply political, abstract notion, peace is now an imperative that leads to the prosperity of the Korean Peninsula and the international community. Arirang TV launches the new program "Peace and Prosperity" to explore paths to peace and prosperity, with a special emphasis on the expected role of Seoul.(n)

programme.desc: High Voltage Killer - After meeting several electric eel attack victims and hearing stories of people who lost their lives, Cyril is determined to catch the biggest one possible and measure its voltage. The only problem is how to avoid being electrocuted in the process.(n)

programme.title: Dynasties S2
programme.desc: Elephant - In Kenya, an incredibly rare event pushes a struggling elephant family to its limits. To save their dynasty, they have to work together and overcome the challenge of a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure S1
programme.desc: Venice, Albania and Turkey - Joanna starts her adventure in Venice, the European terminus of the Silk Road where she discovers how the Silk Road helped the merchants of Venice and the city state itself grow rich and powerful.(n)

programme.title: The World's Deadliest Weather S5
programme.desc: A flash flood in Australia leaves a family running scared. In Wisconsin, a woman and her dog risk getting swept under the ice and a tornado forces a man to take cover in Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: Earth from Space S1
programme.desc: Colourful Planet - From space Earth is a kaleidoscope. Turquoise plankton blooms trigger a feeding frenzy, China turns yellow with rapeseed flowers, and mysterious green lights appear in the ocean.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet S7
programme.desc: Trigger, Fury and Raven - Police dog Trigger has crushed sciatic nerves, feisty kitten Fury has a suspected tibia injury, and will shepherd doodle Raven get a new hip?(n)

programme.title: Coast New Zealand S2
programme.desc: West Coast - Maritime archaeologist Matt Carter explores the West Coast's treacherous sea-faring history, while Scottish historian and archaeologist Neil Oliver discovers a secret beach and goes out on a limb on coastal cliffs.(n)

programme.title: The Persians - A History of Iran S1
programme.desc: Samira Ahmed reveals how Iran preserved its distinctive language and culture despite the Arab conquest of Persia.(n)

programme.title: Big Cats: The Science of
programme.desc: Scientists are constantly making discoveries that reveal new insight into big cat behaviour and physiology. This programme explores big cats ranging from cheetahs to Andean mountain cats.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Earth S1
programme.desc: Aurora - The largest of all of Earth's displays stretches across thousands of kilometres in the night sky: the Aurora Borealis. The arctic wilderness of Northern Sweden is one of the best places to witness the aurora. Discover how it is created, by witnessing the beauty of total eclipses, a mass turtle migration in Costa Rica and powerful tidal whirlpools off the west coast of Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Coast New Zealand S2
programme.desc: West Coast - Maritime archaeologist Matt Carter explores the West Coast's treacherous sea-faring history, while Scottish historian and archaeologist Neil Oliver discovers a secret beach and goes out on a limb on coastal cliffs.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - Dragon Mountain: Surviving the Summit
programme.desc: South Africa's Drakensberg is one of the continent's most impressive landscapes. It is home to sharp climatic and ecological gradients as physical conditions change for both land-based creatures and the Raptors that swirl in the skies above.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - Lake Manyara National Park
programme.desc: In north Tanzania, towering mountains line a dramatic valley. Enriched by ancient volcanoes, its slopes provide a variety of habitats for life to thrive and its great centerpiece holds water through even the driest of times.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Home Away from Home
programme.desc: Swim upriver with the Bay Family, where Anna offers a hand raising her grandpups before heading home to find interlopers on her turf. Watch a flood in the mangroves nearly sweep away a baby, and see the Townies eat clean through their resources.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Asia's Longest Day
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam’s twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance and raising their families.(n)

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands 1 - Christmas Island
programme.desc: Christmas Island, over a thousand kilometres northwest of Australia’s mainland, is a speck of an island that rises out of the Indian Ocean, a tiny refuge to plants and creatures found nowhere else in the world. Birds rule its skies and it’s stunning landscapes are the stage for a miracle migration of millions.(n)

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands 1 - Fraser Island
programme.desc: Just to the south of the Great Barrier Reef and the Tropic of Capricorn, Fraser Island lies like a sprawling lizard. Some 120 kilometers long and up to 25 kilometers wide, Fraser Island is now the largest sand island on Earth. Somehow on this nutrient-poor bed of sand life has thrived. Dingoes patrol its forests in search of wallabies while white-bellied sea eagles scour the beaches from above. From the lakes to the forests and its crystal clear streams - Fraser Island is a unique mosaic of unlikely habitats that have earned it World Heritage Status.(n)

programme.title: Animal Empires 1 - Migration
programme.desc: Epic flights, adventurous sea journeys and exhausting road trips all play a key part in the lives of many species. These empires travel in search of food, shelter or a mate. But booking and organizing travel is no easy feat when those plans involve hundreds – even thousands – of individuals.(n)

programme.title: Nomads of the Serengeti 1 - Return to the Mara
programme.desc: Wildlife expert and Safari guide Jean Du Plessis is in the south of the Serengeti plains to witness the largest mass birth on the planet. Every year on the short grass plains, the wildebeest migration stops for weeks while the females give birth. Then the entire herd begins to move again, heading back north towards the Mara River, where crocodiles lie in wait for an annual feast.(n)

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys 1 - Crossing the Danakil
programme.desc: The Danakil Depression in Ethiopia is not only one of the most inhospitable places on Earth, but is one of the most geologically active. Now, volcanologist Tom Pfeiffer is taking a group of adventure tourists to cross the Danakil to see the Erte Ale volcano.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - Dragon Mountain: Surviving the Summit
programme.desc: South Africa's Drakensberg is one of the continent's most impressive landscapes. It is home to sharp climatic and ecological gradients as physical conditions change for both land-based creatures and the Raptors that swirl in the skies above.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - Lake Manyara National Park

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys 1 - The Child of Fire
programme.desc: For volcanologist Tom Pfeiffer, any volcanic activity that happens in Indonesia is of interest due to its location of the largest eruption in modern history--Krakatoa. Now, Anak, a son of Krakatoa, appears to be going into a more violent phase so Tom heads to Indonesia to see if the Child of Fire is ready to repeat the pattern of its ancestor.(n)

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys 1 - The Gates of Hell
programme.desc: Italy's Mount Etna is one of the best places for volcano watchers and volcanologist Tom Pfeffier is hoping to get lucky and see a paroxysmal eruption, a short and very intense eruption that produces spectacular lava fountains.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Florida
programme.desc: Florida is famous for its sandy shores—and there’s plenty to go around. Florida has the most tidal shoreline of any state in the continental USA. These ocean-side playgrounds are also critical habitats for threatened and endangered species.(n)

programme.title: Nomads of the Serengeti 1 - Ngorongoro
programme.desc: Explores the Ngorogoro’s highlands and caldera on the edge of the Serengeti. The caldera is a wildlife haven that some have called a modern day Eden because of the density and diversity of its wildlife. That includes some of the last of Africa’s “tuskers.”.(n)

programme.title: Dogs with Extraordinary Jobs 1 - The Partners
programme.desc: Meet a golden retriever that assuages anxiety and helps heal PTSD, a shepherd mix who rescues mudslide survivors, a pair of spaniels who sniff out underground water leaks, and a group of teacher’s pets in the UK that assist children learning to read.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - A New Zealand Christmas
programme.desc: See how one animal family’s tragedy is another’s holiday dinner as New Zealand’s mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.(n)

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands 1 - Christmas Island

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue 1 - One Very Lost Sea Turtle
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.(n)

programme.title: Turtle Beach
programme.desc: Locals call it the ‘arribada’, or ‘arrival’. The magical days and nights when tens of thousands of sea turtles come ashore in Costa Rica, to lay millions of eggs. In Turtle Beach, new discoveries abound, as Canadian naturalist and cameraman Hugo Kitching follows a team of international scientists on a groundbreaking expedition to uncover the mysteries of this rare phenomenon.(n)

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys 1 - The Fires of Pele
programme.desc: The number one tourist attraction on the island of Hawaii is a volcano called Kilauea. After a sudden collapse of the crater floor, a massive eruption drains the volcano of lava and now Kilauea is silent. Geologist Phillip Ong finally has his chance to explore.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Apex Predators
programme.desc: Apex predators seem to have won the evolutionary lottery. These species hunt and kill with superior strength, and attack with impressive strategy and mechanics. They are at the top of their game and at the top of the food chain.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Nova Scotia
programme.desc: At either edge of the province, Nova Scotia proves that any beach is built from raw forces in opposition, but also that balance between those forces is necessary if life is to thrive.(n)

programme.title: Nomads of the Serengeti 1 - Snows of Kilimanjaro
programme.desc: Mt. Kilimanjaro is the highest freestanding peak in Africa, it has five separate climatic zones. Jean Du Plessis is making his first climb to the peak. His mission is to see whether climate change is affecting the snow on the top of the mountain.(n)

programme.title: Dogs with Extraordinary Jobs 1 - The Protectors
programme.desc: A blind woman has found a new lease on life thanks to her canine running mate, a Jack Russell works as a super-nanny to a surprising array of species, and a team of dogs in Kenya are on daily patrol protecting endangered rhinos from poachers.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - India & Sri Lanka's Deadly Mother's Day
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.(n)

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue 1 - One Very Lost Sea Turtle
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.(n)

programme.title: Planet Shark 1 - In the Extreme
programme.desc: Follow a host of sharks with extraordinary abilities that allow them to thrive in the most adverse conditions around the globe. Observe nearly blind Greenland sharks made for life in freezing Arctic waters, and another species that can walk on land.(n)

programme.title: How the Wild Things Sleep
programme.desc: There is an endless variety of sleep-strategies among animals, yet it seems a universal behavior. But why bother with sleep at all? How do animals cope without sleep or the dangers of being unconscious in the wild? Just some of the baffling questions that lead through How the Wild Things Sleep.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Birds of Prey
programme.desc: Birds of prey are amazing hunters. Their adaptations allow them to catch a wide range of prey in a variety of environments. This is a look at some of the most fearsome North American birds of prey.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Insect Eaters
programme.desc: Every predator needs a speciality - and these tenacious insect-eaters have a great one. They evolved to hunt a virtually unlimited food source: bugs. With highly-developed hunting skills, they source, kill and consume with great success.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons 2 - Ghosts of Cederberg
programme.desc: A rocky landscape, carved over eons by wind, water and fire, these are the Cederberg Mountains of South Africa. These imposing peaks are home to an incredible diversity of plants and animals. But there are some here that remain unseen, lurking in the shadows and ready to strike at any time...(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons 2 - Namib: Land Of Extremes
programme.desc: The Namib Desert is a land of extremes, from icy ocean to baking sand. It takes toughness and adaptation to live in this desert, and only a special few can. From the sidewinding adder to the fog-collecting beetle, each animal has their tricks for survival in the Namib.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons 2 - The Last Desert Giants
programme.desc: The Namib is the oldest desert in the world, hugging Africa’s shoreline for over 400 kilometers. It is one of the most inhospitable habitats on earth. Yet the world’s largest land mammal has made a home here, adapted through behavior and designed to life in the extreme.(n)

programme.title: Colombia's Wild Coast 1 - Snake Prison Island
programme.desc: Gorgona was once home to Colombia’s Alcatraz. Modelled on Nazi concentration camps, prisoners dreamt of escape. See the island’s stunning wildlife through the eyes of a convict on the run, the monkeys, snakes and sloths who’ve now reclaimed the land.(n)

programme.title: Weird, Wild & Wonderful
programme.desc: Trek across Africa for a peek at the colorful, quirky survival strategies of its animals. See these furry, feathered, and scaled magicians, from flamboyant flamingos to vanishing lizards, find food, elude predators, and find mates against all odds.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - City of Riches
programme.desc: Stake out the Bay Family’s lush territory, where matriarch Anna offers lavish feasts but faces internal dissent. Size up her rival Mia, the streetwise Townies leader who’s eyeing a lifestyle upgrade, and check in with the isolated Mangrove Family.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Home Away from Home
programme.desc: Swim upriver with the Bay Family, where Anna offers a hand raising her grandpups before heading home to find interlopers on her turf. Watch a flood in the mangroves nearly sweep away a baby, and see the Townies eat clean through their resources.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - A Busy Bay
programme.desc: Get ready to rumble in Marina Bay, where the Nomads and Townies are squatting while Anna and the Bay Family are away upriver. Soak up the peaceful otter life in this luxurious waterway before the surprise early return of its rightful owners.(n)

programme.title: Wild Tales from the Farm 1 - Leaping Into Life
programme.desc: It’s spring, and the farm is bursting with new life. Watch a ewe give birth to twins, an orphaned Hereford calf struggle to find a surrogate mother, and the top hen nestle down in her maternity coop.(n)

programme.title: Wild Tales from the Farm 1 - Great Escape
programme.desc: Experience life on the farm as things heat up for summer. Watch animals swelter in a rare heatwave, try to stay cool in the nearby freshwater stream, and stash supplies for fall.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Birds of Prey
programme.desc: Birds of prey are amazing hunters. Their adaptations allow them to catch a wide range of prey in a variety of environments. This is a look at some of the most fearsome North American birds of prey.(n)

programme.title: Colombia's Wild Coast 1 - Snake Prison Island
programme.desc: Gorgona was once home to Colombia’s Alcatraz. Modelled on Nazi concentration camps, prisoners dreamt of escape. See the island’s stunning wildlife through the eyes of a convict on the run, the monkeys, snakes and sloths who’ve now reclaimed the land.(n)

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Nearly 20 hours of sunlight a day feed the season of abundance. Warmth unlocks water from the glaciers, ice caves and waterfalls. The water crashes into countless streams of the Inside Passage, feeding forest and wildlife alike. From June to August, Alaska becomes a paradise for it’s wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Wild Latin America 1 - Humpback Birth of a Giant
programme.desc: Follow the first months of a newborn humpback whale’s life in the waters off the Pacific Coast of Columbia. See how his mother nurtures him through sickness, supports his body, protects him under attack, and prepares him for an epic journey.(n)

programme.title: Wild Latin America 1 - Squirrel Monkey Island
programme.desc: Travel deep into the Columbian rainforest, where it’s mating season for one of the most clever monkey species in the world. Witness the most important time of year for male squirrel monkeys that have been bulking up to impress females for months.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Insect Eaters

programme.title: Wild Tales from the Farm 1 - Great Escape
programme.desc: Experience life on the farm as things heat up for summer. Watch animals swelter in a rare heatwave, try to stay cool in the nearby freshwater stream, and stash supplies for fall.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Cold-Blooded Killers
programme.desc: From our point of view, cold-blooded predators are brutal, savvy, programmed killers. But from their point of view, it’s just another day at the butcher’s counter. These are some of the most fearsome predators on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Masters of Defence
programme.desc: Staying alive is job one for these masters of defence. With clever adaptations like mimicry and poison on their side, they continue to outwit predators.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons 2 - Crowded Islands
programme.desc: On rocky islands off the coast of South Africa, thousands of creatures congregate to breed. Among these, huge colonies of cape gannets dominate. Surrounded by rich waters, they can find enough to feed themselves and their young. But life is full of challenges for the breeding gannets...(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons 2 - Return to the Wild
programme.desc: The Eastern Cape Province is investing heavily in ecotourism and conservation as an alternative to fishing and commercial development. The region is reclaiming farmlands and closing fishing grounds for wildlife. This is one of the most exciting conservation success stories in Africa.(n)

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Nearly 20 hours of sunlight a day feed the season of abundance. Warmth unlocks water from the glaciers, ice caves and waterfalls. The water crashes into countless streams of the Inside Passage, feeding forest and wildlife alike. From June to August, Alaska becomes a paradise for it’s wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Colombia's Wild Coast 1 - March of the Crabs
programme.desc: On the island of Providencia, a black crab begins the mission of her life, escorting 80,000 eggs from her home, on a 3 km hike to the coast. Join her, and millions of her clan, on a journey fraught with danger, where chances of survival are slim.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year 1 - Spring
programme.desc: In Southern Africa, Spring starts in early September and the natural world stirs into life. Days begin to lengthen, temperatures rise, and animals and plants combine in an orchestrated effort to reproduce, give birth and raise their young.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year 1 - Summer
programme.desc: Summer in Africa is a season of extremes, it separates the weak from the strong. It tests the survival instincts of cheetahs, lions, geckos, turtles and many more species as they search for food and water in the extreme heat of summer.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Pacific Islands: Commotion in the Ocean
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Australian Spring Fever
programme.desc: Celebrate the first day of spring with Aussie creatures looking for either a dinner or a date. From the kangaroos in the grasslands to the koalas in the trees to the freshwater crocodiles, they hunt for food or fight for breeding rights.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Madagascar: Lizards and Lemurs
programme.desc: Meet the unique primates and reptiles searching for water and dodging predators, from ring-tailed lemurs in the east coast rainforests to tiny brown leaf chameleons, in this land of extreme climate variations and habitats.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Arabia: Kingdom of the Sun
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.(n)

programme.title: After the Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia’s catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.(n)

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Masters of Defence

programme.title: Attack and Defend 1 - Water Warriors
programme.desc: From powerful sharks to mysterious and beautiful fish shoals, the underwater dynamic between predator and prey continues. Evolution is on display in these clever creatures as they use all their skills to survive.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 1
programme.desc: Enjoy the spring baby boom at the center as the staff go gaga over an adorable bundle of baby possums. Then see the rescue team hit a rooftop patio for a little R and R: retrieving and rescuing a mama and her ducklings perched high above the city.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Mexico
programme.desc: The mythology of Mexico’s Yucatan Peninsula includes a protective Earth Mother figure, “Ixchel,” who brings fertility and healing to the region. In the shadow of Ixchel, we witness an ancient birthing ritual happening yearly on Mexican beaches: mother green sea turtles haul themselves onto the sands and bury their clutches of eggs.(n)

programme.title: Nomads of the Serengeti 1 - Cradle of Mankind
programme.desc: Wildlife expert and safari guide Jean Du Plessis travels to Mahale Mountains National Park in the hopes of spending time with the wild chimpanzees that live in the forests of this remote and protected corner of Tanzania.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - City of Riches
programme.desc: Stake out the Bay Family’s lush territory, where matriarch Anna offers lavish feasts but faces internal dissent. Size up her rival Mia, the streetwise Townies leader who’s eyeing a lifestyle upgrade, and check in with the isolated Mangrove Family.(n)

programme.title: Carpathian Predators 1 - Realm of the Bear
programme.desc: Join a mother brown bear as she struggles to find food for her two young cubs while teaching them essential skills for the harsh winter ahead. Then visit a pair of tiny lynx kittens as they begin to venture away from the safety of their den.(n)

programme.title: Carpathian Predators 1 - Realm of the Wolf
programme.desc: In the remote wilderness of the Carpathian Mountains lives an elusive predator that has inspired awe and fear throughout history: the Eurasian wolf. Discover the vital role that these once-misunderstood hunters play in protecting their ecosystem.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - City of Riches

programme.title: Life's Journey 1 - Life's Legacies
programme.desc: For every species on earth the right to mate is the purpose of life. Passing on your genes to the next generation is every animal’s legacy. But it’s not easy, it can be a struggle to find a mate and then a fight to gain access. Only the strongest and most determined will win at Luangwa’s mating game.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Hunters 1 - The Hungry Leopard
programme.desc: A revolutionary thermal camera reveals the secret world of nocturnal predators. Follow along as one of the oldest-known leopards struggles to survive her fearsome neighbors: a pride of scavenging lions.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 2
programme.desc: See staff care for baby bunnies injured in a dog attack and then join the center’s release team as they introduce an abandoned cygnet to an adoptive mother swan, and find that things don’t go exactly as planned.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 3
programme.desc: Join the search for a Cooper’s hawk who’s taken a dangerous dip in a backyard pool. Catch the hijinks of the centre’s skunks as they try to avoid getting their shots, giving the team a closeup experience with the animals’ stinky natural defences.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Hawaii
programme.desc: Throughout the Hawaiian Islands, natural forces of creation and destruction can be observed in real-time as they work to shape the living beach. These beaches are forged inside active volcanoes: every bit of land exists here because of these red-hot furnaces.(n)

programme.title: Zambia Untamed 1 - The Outcasts
programme.desc: In the Luangwa Valley lies a grove of Ebony trees, home to a troop of baboons. But, there are dangers here – the resident leopard who, unlike the other predators, is powerful and agile enough to climb trees. He’s not an easy foe to elude.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Simien Mountains
programme.desc: Simien Mountains National Park in Ethiopia is home to some of the rarest creatures on earth. Take a glimpse into life on some of the highest peaks in Africa, in the last stronghold of shaggy, grass-grazing Geladas, elusive Simien wolves and horned Walia ibex.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Southern Drylands
programme.desc: The Southern Drylands is a journey into the most arid and extreme environments in the furthest reaches of southern Africa. We go to spectacular but treacherous places where almost no rain falls, to find incredibly resilient creatures and learn the secrets to their survival. From the largest mammals to the fastest insects and even a ghost-like fish found nowhere else in the world, the Southern Drylands contain some extraordinary inhabitants, all connected by the daily challenges of living in some of most inhospitable habitats in the world.(n)

programme.desc: Swim upriver with the Bay Family, where Anna offers a hand raising her grandpups before heading home to find interlopers on her turf. Watch a flood in the mangroves nearly sweep away a baby, and see the Townies eat clean through their resources.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Pacific Islands: Commotion in the Ocean
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Simien Mountains
programme.desc: Simien Mountains National Park in Ethiopia is home to some of the rarest creatures on earth. Take a glimpse into life on some of the highest peaks in Africa, in the last stronghold of shaggy, grass-grazing Geladas, elusive Simien wolves and horned Walia ibex.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Southern Drylands
programme.desc: The Southern Drylands is a journey into the most arid and extreme environments in the furthest reaches of southern Africa. We go to spectacular but treacherous places where almost no rain falls, to find incredibly resilient creatures and learn the secrets to their survival. From the largest mammals to the fastest insects and even a ghost-like fish found nowhere else in the world, the Southern Drylands contain some extraordinary inhabitants, all connected by the daily challenges of living in some of most inhospitable habitats in the world.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Hawaii
programme.desc: Throughout the Hawaiian Islands, natural forces of creation and destruction can be observed in real-time as they work to shape the living beach. These beaches are forged inside active volcanoes: every bit of land exists here because of these red-hot furnaces.(n)

programme.title: Zambia Untamed 1 - The Outcasts
programme.desc: In the Luangwa Valley lies a grove of Ebony trees, home to a troop of baboons. But, there are dangers here – the resident leopard who, unlike the other predators, is powerful and agile enough to climb trees. He’s not an easy foe to elude.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 3
programme.desc: Join the search for a Cooper’s hawk who’s taken a dangerous dip in a backyard pool. Catch the hijinks of the centre’s skunks as they try to avoid getting their shots, giving the team a closeup experience with the animals’ stinky natural defences.(n)

programme.title: Life's Journey 1 - Life's Legacies
programme.desc: For every species on earth the right to mate is the purpose of life. Passing on your genes to the next generation is every animal’s legacy. But it’s not easy, it can be a struggle to find a mate and then a fight to gain access. Only the strongest and most determined will win at Luangwa’s mating game.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Hunters 1 - The Hungry Leopard
programme.desc: A revolutionary thermal camera reveals the secret world of nocturnal predators. Follow along as one of the oldest-known leopards struggles to survive her fearsome neighbors: a pride of scavenging lions.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Home Away from Home
programme.desc: Swim upriver with the Bay Family, where Anna offers a hand raising her grandpups before heading home to find interlopers on her turf. Watch a flood in the mangroves nearly sweep away a baby, and see the Townies eat clean through their resources.(n)

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk 1 - Pacific Islands: Commotion in the Ocean
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Simien Mountains
programme.desc: Simien Mountains National Park in Ethiopia is home to some of the rarest creatures on earth. Take a glimpse into life on some of the highest peaks in Africa, in the last stronghold of shaggy, grass-grazing Geladas, elusive Simien wolves and horned Walia ibex.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Africa 1 - The Southern Drylands
programme.desc: The Southern Drylands is a journey into the most arid and extreme environments in the furthest reaches of southern Africa. We go to spectacular but treacherous places where almost no rain falls, to find incredibly resilient creatures and learn the secrets to their survival. From the largest mammals to the fastest insects and even a ghost-like fish found nowhere else in the world, the Southern Drylands contain some extraordinary inhabitants, all connected by the daily challenges of living in some of most inhospitable habitats in the world.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 4
programme.desc: When a baby mink is abandoned in a store, the team gets to work on some behavioural training. But will this sweet little one be tough enough for the wild when they’re done? Visit with a mange-afflicted coyote who’s enjoying some alone time to heal.(n)

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue 1 - Episode 5
programme.desc: A curious raccoon sticks his head a little too far into a peanut butter jar on a sweltering summer day in Toronto. See how the team gets him out of this sticky situation. Then cheer on a painted turtle who needs emergency eye surgery.(n)

programme.title: The Living Beach 1 - Australia
programme.desc: It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.(n)

programme.title: Zambia Untamed 1 - Living on the Edge
programme.desc: The plains and woodlands of the Luangwa Valley are the wildest and most merciless of all neighborhoods where duels between predator and prey are played out both day and night. For the animals that call this home, it’s a daily battle to stay alive.(n)

programme.title: Meet The Drapers (S5)
programme.desc: The Drapers and special guest judges, Peter Diamandis and Andrew Tang, hear pitches from 3 Canadian companies with innovative solutions. This week episode features Respira, KA Imaging, and ChimeraXR.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank (S10)
programme.desc: A husband and wife pitch their rooftop assistance design that helps access your vehicle’s roof with one step; entrepreneurs present their fitness workout that offers an alternative to the treadmill.(n)

programme.desc: Glory - FaZe Clan, INTZ and Gen.G are lining up for major events, and they’re hoping to claim esports glory. The prize for winning can be huge, but so is the personal sacrifice to make it happen.(n)

programme.title: Rupert Bear S1
programme.desc: Rupert Saves Christmas - While riding his sleigh in the sky towards the North Pole on Christmas Eve, Crinkle the snow elf falls & lands in Nutwood. Worried about the fact Santa won't be able to deliver any presents without him Rupert & friends help Crinkle attract Santa's attention in the sky by building a huge magical daisy chain. It begins to fall apart as Crinkle climbs up high and so the gang decorate a magical Christmas tree that can be seen from the sky. As they hear santa's sleigh approaching crinkle climbs the tree & is reunites with Santa ensuring all presents are delivered on Christmas day.(n)

programme.title: Rupert Bear S1
programme.desc: Rupert And The Snow Key - Jack Frost has misplaced his Snow Key which unlocks the Spring. Without the key it will be snowy & Winter in Nutwood forever. Rupert & friends search Nutwood to help find the key unknowing Raggety has found the special key & is keeping it very safe. Will the gang find it in time & unlock Spring in time for the flowers & plants in Nutwood?(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa The Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Raa Raa Goes Hunting - Raa Raa has lost his toothbrush and sets off to find it. Where can it be?(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa The Noisy Lion
programme.desc: The Noisiest House In The Jungle - The animals are exploring what noises each of their houses make… whose house do we think is the noisiest in the whole of the Jingly Jangly Jungle?(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service
programme.desc: Postman Pat'S Pop Star Rescue - Everyone in Greendale is excited because pop superstar, Brad Lee is coming to Pencaster Bay to perform a concert. Unfortunately Brad's luxury private ship has broken down en route so Pat and Jess must head out to sea in the SDS boat and collect him. Meanwhile Julian, Meera, Bill and Sarah are on the train to Pencaster Bay with their mums to watch the concert. The kids enter into a cacophonous ‘sing off' to decide who is the best singer. Pat and Jess collect Brad Lee from his ship only to find that he's afraid of small boats! Pat heads to shore as quickly as possible but unfortunately gets diverted to pick up a poorly puffin from Chris beacon at the lighthouse. Back at the Pencaster Bay the kids competitiveness leads to a dance off against the mums, who do surprisingly well. Pat finally manages to get the poorly puffin ashore to be treated by Amy the vet and Brad Lee goes on to perform a blistering concert by the seaside!(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service
programme.desc: Postman Pat And The Very Important Person - PC Selby is being honoured with a medal for being “Best local Policeman of the year” and Pat is despatched to Pencaster bay to collect both the medal and the person who is going to present it; The Duchess of Pencaster! Somewhat star struck Pat and Jess drive the Duchess towards Pencaster back to the award ceremony at Greendale but at her request they stop to help some of the villagers which unfortunately leads to her getting covered in coal dust and mud! PC Selby is also on his way to Greendale and also finds people in need of help and his best uniform is soon torn and covered in paint and compost! The Duchess and PC Selby meet and wonder quite how they are going to explain their tattered appearance to the crowd at the award ceremony. Luckily Pat explains how both PC Selby and The Duchess put helping others before themselves. Special delivery service – mission accomplished!(n)

programme.title: Fifi And The Flowertots
programme.desc: Grubby Ahoy - Grubby has got stuck on Aunt Tulip's boat. Can anybody save him before he floats away?(n)

programme.title: Fifi And The Flowertots

Dennis and the Gang bravely climb up to Ginormotown, determined to find Gnasher and bring Christmas back. On their quest they end up giving away all their christmas goodies, showing the Ginormotowners – and themselves what Christmas is really about!(n)

Poppy races to discover the identity of the mysterious tagger, before all of Trolls Village ends up frozen.(n)

programme.title: Dawn Of The Croods
programme.desc: Gran The Unfriendly Ghost/Bad Sandy - Gran is sick of the Croods not listening to her advice and fakes her own death. But, when the Croods don't mourn to her liking, she haunts them/Ahhh! Valley threatens to exile Sandy after a string of bad behavior unless the Croods can get her under control.(n)

programme.desc: True Romancings / Hardcore Harbor - After Lucy goes on another bad date, Tip and Oh set on a mission to find her a guy; When Oh to shows Elrod around a waterpark, everything goes wrong.(n)

programme.desc: Lucky And The Price Of Freedom - Grayson wrangles Spirit "fair and square" and sends him to auction in another town --and there is nothing Lucky can do to stop him!(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: Why Meerkat Is Always On The Look Out - You see there was a time when Meerkat was not always on the lookout. Meerkat used to race around Tinga Tinga bumping into things and causing chaos. She never stayed still long enough to listen to any beast. But then one day Meerkat bumps into the Sleeping Stones... and they make her listen alright! Tales from Africa.(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: Why Cheetah Has Tears - You see there was a time when Cheetah didn't have tears. She was the fastest animal in the whole of Tinga Tinga. Cheetah was faster than even the Wind. Every year Cheetah and Wind would race to see who was the fastest and every year Cheetah would win. Until one day.... Tales from Africa.(n)

programme.title: Noddy Toyland Detective
programme.desc: The Case Of The Unfunny Clown - Noddy and his friends are having a “clown day” and everyone is going to play at being clowns. Noddy shows Fuse his smelling flower joke but Fuse realises he isn't programmed to understand clowning. The clowning goes too far when someone sets up a bucket of balls joke that almost causes an accident. Noddy needs to investigate to find out who is the unfunny clown before a ‘joke' goes too far. Using all his detecting skills and reconsidering evidence, Noddy works out that the unfunny clown is actually Fuse! He didn't realise that the clowning jokes he was playing on the other toys weren't actually funny! Noddy shows Fuse a way in which he can join in with the clowning in a safe way and Clown Day can go ahead after all. Well done Noddy! Case closed!(n)

programme.title: Noddy Toyland Detective
programme.desc: Noddy And The Case Of The Raining Carrots - Farmer Tom is having a Farm Fair at the Animal Acres Farm but it looks set to be ruined by an unexpected shower of carrots, cabbages and then pumpkins. Noddy and Deltoid investigate and discover the raining vegetables are caused by Smartysaurus, who is trying to find something heavy enough to go on the other end of her see-saw. She didn't realise that every time she sat on one end of the see-saw, she was sending the vegetables on the other end flying up into the air. Clever Noddy realises that Deltoid and Smartysaurus are matched in weight and are, therefore, the ideal partners to play on the see-saw. The friendly dinosaur is delighted and the Farm Fair can go ahead without any more raining vegetables- thanks to Noddy! Case closed!(n)

programme.title: Guess With Jess
programme.desc: Why Are Acorns Buried Under The Tree? - Jess and the puppies find a pile of acorns buried under a tree. The puppies want to play with them, but Jess thinks they should find out why the acorns are buried there first. That's the Big Question! Baa and Billie don't know – Billie says she'd eat acorns rather than bury them! Jess goes off to see Mimi who's planting her conker to grow a chestnut tree. Jess wonders if someone planted the acorns to grown into an oak but Mimi doesn't think so. They'd need to be buried somewhere with more space to grow. Jess tries Willow who is storing apples for the winter. She explains that she'll eat the apples when food is scarce in the winter months. Jess wonders if someone is storing the acorns. He and the puppies go back to the tree and wait. Soon a Squirrel pops out from the tree and buries another acorn. Jess and the pups are glad they didn't play with the acorns. Squirrel's storing them for Winter. They've answered the question – yippety yay!(n)

programme.title: Guess With Jess
programme.desc: How Can I Sound Like Brown Bird? - Brown Bird sings a lovely song before leaving for winter migration. Jess would love to sound like Brown Bird – then they could listen to her song all year round. But how can he sound like her? That's the Big Question. Billie and Baa suggest Jess sings but his singing voice doesn't sound like Brown Bird at all. Mimi tries to mimic Brown Bird by whistling but that's not the right sound either. Maybe if Jess makes a hooty sound by blowing through his paws? That's still not the right sound. Jess tells his friends that it's more of a whistley sound – a bit like the wind whistling through the reeds at Horace's pond. So they go to the pond. Horace shows Jess how to blow through the reeds – and it sounds just like Brown Bird. They've found the Answer. Yippety yay!(n)

programme.desc: The Right Sound - One of the pipes on Huffty's Toot Stick has broken. Can Raa Raa help his friend find the "right" sound to replace it in the jungle so they can play loud music together?(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service
programme.desc: Postman Pat And The Cornish Caper - Ted Glenn's Cornish cousin Ned is sending him a steam engine as an alternative means to power his workshop. Pat and Jess set off to Cornwall to collect this very large special delivery in the SDS Plane whilst Ted sets about giving away all of his old inventions to the people of Greendale in order to clear out enough space for the engine. Pat and Jess meet the eccentric Ned Glenn at his workshop and wrestle with the crate containing the heavy engine to get it aboard the plane. Back in Greendale the villagers are only too delighted to take all of Ted's weird and wonderful inventions off his hands but the more inventions that go, the more gloomy Ted gets. After a trip over a very bumpy field and flight in the plane, Pat finally delivers the engine to a now very sad Ted. He's depressed because he loves to tinkering with things, and now he has nothing left to tinker with. Maybe the engine will cheer him up but when Pat takes the side off the crate, just a heap of engine parts spill out. The engine was shaken apart on the journey. Pat is very sorry but Ted is delighted. Now he has something to tinker with again! Mission accomplished!(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service
programme.desc: Postman Pat And The Giant Pumpkin - Pat has to deliver some pumpkins to Greendale School for the annual Halloween Pumpkin Party. But when he picks them up from Ted's workshop, Jess starts playing with a giant pumpkin and it rolls into the river and floats away. Pat follows it along the river and tries to fish it out with Alf's rod but the pumpkin is too heavy and the line breaks. As the party gets under way in Greendale, the giant pumpkin floats out to sea and Pat and Jess board the SDS Orca and head out into Pencaster Bay. With help from Chris Beacon and his radar machine they at last manage to locate the pumpkin then hurry back to Greendale just in time. Pat then surprises everyone by arriving with the giant pumpkin now carved with a big Jess face!(n)

programme.title: Fifi And The Flowertots

programme.desc: Why Elephant Has A Trunk - You see there was a time when Elephant had no nose. He couldn't swat away the flies, or scrub his belly… he couldn't even blow his nose. Then one day snappy Crocodile snapped! Crocodile pulled and he pulled and he pulled… until Ker-doing!!! Crocodile let go and Elephant's nose was all long and wiggly! And that's why Elephant has a trunk. Tales from Africa.(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: Why Snake Has No Legs - You see there was a time when Snake did have legs… hundreds and hundreds of them. But poor old Snake had no eyes, not a single eye on his head. Then on the day of the great Tinga Tinga Festival of Colours Snake quite literally bumped into Millipede who was stuck in a hole. They decided to swap eyes and legs just for one day. So that Snake could see all the wonderful colours and Millipede could run all over Tinga Tinga. But when Snake came back to return Millipede's eyes, Millepede couldn't be found anywhere! So to this day, Snake has no legs. Tales from Africa.(n)

programme.title: Noddy Toyland Detective
programme.desc: Case Of The Broken Crystal Memory Game - All the toys are ready to start the exciting DareDale Challenge race, which culminates in the competitors successfully completing the Crystal Memory Game in the DareDale Caves. Before the race can start everyone is disappointed to discover that the Crystal Memory Game has been broken. Whilst Clockwork Mouse gets the game mended, Noddy must investigate who broke the game so that they don't break it again. Using his investigating skills in questioning, gathering evidence on the WhoWhatWhere Tablet and thinking, Noddy discovers that Deltoid accidentally broke the game when he was trying to memorise the crystal sorting sequence. Clever Noddy helps Deltoid remember the sequence by remembering the shapes and they are able to finish the game together. Case Closed!(n)

programme.desc: Postman Pat’S Pancake Party - Pat must deliver eggs, milk, flour and butter to Greendale for the annual Pancake Race. But when Michael mixes all the ingredients together, Pat finds that he instead has to deal with a mixing bowl full to the brim with pancake mix... Meanwhile in Greendale, Sara's attempts at pancake-tossing aren't going well and she soon loses her pancake under the wheels of PC Selby's car. Even worse, Ted Glen's amazing Pancake Machine has run out of mix so Sara won't be able to run the race unless Pat can get to Greendale on time... But Pat gets waylaid by Alf's cows and the pancake mix ends up all over the road. Pat hurries back to Pencaster but Michael now only has butter and flour so Pat has to go and get eggs from Nisha and even some milk from Rosie the goat! With the race about to start, Pat arrives just in time with all the ingredients necessary for Ted to make Sara a fresh pancake. SDS Mission accomplished!(n)
